perturbation.original_text:
CEIS represents and warrants to XFN that during the Term of this Agreement:

     (d)  the Content complies with and will comply with all applicable laws and           regulations;
perturbation.changed_text:
CEIS represents and warrants to XFN that during the Term of this Agreement:

     (d)  CEIS will use reasonable efforts to ensure the content complies with all applicable laws and regulations.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'the Content complies with and will comply with all applicable laws and regulations' to 'CEIS will use reasonable efforts to ensure the content complies with all applicable laws and regulations' significantly weakens the guarantee, potentially violating consumer protection laws or regulations in Hong Kong that require content providers to ensure their content is legally compliant. The original clause provides a guarantee, whereas the modified clause only promises an effort, shifting the risk to XFN.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates Hong Kong's Trade Descriptions Ordinance or similar consumer protection regulations requiring accurate and compliant content.

perturbation.original_text:
8.   TERMINATION

8.1  XFN may terminate this Agreement by giving thirty (30) days written notice      to the CEIS.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.   TERMINATION

8.1  XFN may terminate this Agreement at CEIS's discretion.
perturbation.explanation: By modifying 'XFN may terminate this Agreement by giving thirty (30) days written notice to the CEIS.' to 'XFN may terminate this Agreement at CEIS's discretion,' the contract now lacks a clear, unconditional termination right for XFN. Under contract law principles, particularly those concerning fair trading and good faith, this is unusual. It can be seen as an unfairly restrictive clause. This undermines the balance of power between the parties, favoring CEIS.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates Hong Kong's Control of Exemption Clauses Ordinance or similar fairness standards in contract law.

perturbation.changed_text:
6.   INDEMNITY

6.1  CEIS shall indemnify XFN from and against direct damages which may be incurred or suffered by or taken against XFN in relation to:

     (a)  the exercise by XFN of the rights granted herein; and

     (b)  any breach by CEIS of any provision of this Agreement or any act,

Source: XINHUA SPORTS & ENTERTAINMENT LTD, F-1, 2/21/2007
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'CEIS shall fully indemnify XFN and hold XFN harmless from and against any and all costs, expenses, loss, damages, liabilities, claims and proceedings' to 'CEIS shall indemnify XFN from and against direct damages which may be incurred or suffered by or taken against XFN in relation to,' significantly narrows the scope of indemnification. Removing "fully," "all costs, expenses, loss, damages, liabilities, claims and proceedings" and changing it to "direct damages" limits XFN's protection against potential liabilities arising from CEIS's actions. It creates a much weaker indemnity. This may be considered unfair.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates Hong Kong's Supply of Services (Implied Terms) Ordinance or similar regulations requiring reasonable care and skill, by significantly limiting liability for potential damages resulting from CEIS's actions.
